snippet: Court records released by mistake show that police officers investigating death of an Iraqi woman living in California, considered a possible hate crime, have also been looking at family members.
abstract: Unsealed court documents reveal that the family of Shaima Alawadi, Iraqi immigrant found bludgeoned to death in her California home, was experiencing a period of crisis, including a divorce and a daughter resisting an arranged marriage; documents have shifted investigators' attention toward family members and lessened the view that Alawadi was the victim of a hate crime.

byline.original: By WILL CARLESS and IAN LOVETT
byline.contributor: Will Carless reported from El Cajon, Calif., and Ian Lovett reported from Los Angeles.

lead_paragraph: Court records released by mistake show that police officers investigating death of an Iraqi woman living in California, considered a possible hate crime, have also been looking at family members.

headline.seo: Shaima Alawadi Court Records Show Family in Crisis
headline.main: Family of Iraqi Woman Killed in California Was in Crisis, Records Show
headline.print_headline: Family of a Murdered Immigrant Was in Crisis, Records Show
